title: Tidymodels Linear Regression
text:
We will demonstrate how to fit a linear regression model with the iris dataset.
First we will load the data.

library(knitr)
library(tidyverse)

data(iris)

iris = iris |>
  rename_with(~ tolower(gsub(".", "_", .x, fixed = TRUE)))

Next, we will visualise the data.

title: Tidymodels Linear Regression
text:
Regression
Next we will fit a linear regression model.



Call:
lm(formula = petal_width ~ petal_length, data = iris)

Residuals:
     Min       1Q   Median       3Q      Max 
-0.56515 -0.12358 -0.01898  0.13288  0.64272 

Coefficients:
              Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
(Intercept)  -0.363076   0.039762  -9.131  4.7e-16 ***
petal_length  0.415755   0.009582  43.387  < 2e-16 ***
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

Residual standard error: 0.2065 on 148 degrees of freedom
Multiple R-squared:  0.9271,    Adjusted R-squared:  0.9266 
F-statistic:  1882 on 1 and 148 DF,  p-value: < 2.2e-16


Next, we will view some diagnostics.

title: Linear Regression
text:
We will demonstrate how to fit a linear regression model to the iris dataset.
First we will load the data.

library(knitr)
library(tidyverse)

data(iris)

iris = iris |>
  rename_with(~ tolower(gsub(".", "_", .x, fixed = TRUE)))

Next, we will visualise the data.

title: Linear Regression
text:
Regression
Next we will fit a linear regression model.



Call:
lm(formula = petal_width ~ petal_length, data = iris)

Residuals:
     Min       1Q   Median       3Q      Max 
-0.56515 -0.12358 -0.01898  0.13288  0.64272 

Coefficients:
              Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
(Intercept)  -0.363076   0.039762  -9.131  4.7e-16 ***
petal_length  0.415755   0.009582  43.387  < 2e-16 ***
---

Residual standard error: 0.2065 on 148 degrees of freedom
Multiple R-squared:  0.9271,    Adjusted R-squared:  0.9266

title: MLFlow Linear Regression
text:
We will demonstrate how to fit a linear regression model package to the Star Wars dataset.
Subsequently, we will track the experiment and deploy the model to an MLFlow server.

if (!require("carrier")) { install.packages("carrier") }

library(carrier)
library(knitr)
library(mlflow)
library(tidyverse)

data = dplyr::starwars

title: MLFlow Linear Regression
text:
Regression
Next we will fit a linear regression model.



Call:
lm(formula = petal_width ~ petal_length, data = iris)

Residuals:
     Min       1Q   Median       3Q      Max 
-0.56515 -0.12358 -0.01898  0.13288  0.64272 

Coefficients:
              Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
(Intercept)  -0.363076   0.039762  -9.131  4.7e-16 ***
petal_length  0.415755   0.009582  43.387  < 2e-16 ***
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

Residual standard error: 0.2065 on 148 degrees of freedom
Multiple R-squared:  0.9271,    Adjusted R-squared:  0.9266 
F-statistic:  1882 on 1 and 148 DF,  p-value: < 2.2e-16


Next, we will view some diagnostics.
